title: Clare Castle Country Park Walking Route

images.title: David Flory / All that remains of Clare Castle
images.caption: All that remains of Clare Castle

images.title: David Flory / Old Station from Clare Castle
images.caption: Old Station from Clare Castle. The Old Station and platforms are now part of Clare Castle Country Park. The railway was closed during the Beeching era. The building itself is now the dwelling and offices of the park ranger. The pole to the left is Clare's millennium beacon.

images.title: Oxyman / Clare Country Park
images.caption: A view of Clare Country Park with the Motte and castle remains in the background

images.title: Oxyman / Flat area on top of Clare Castle Motte
images.caption: Flat area on top of Clare Castle Motte

images.title: Oxyman / Remains of Clare castle keep
images.caption: Remains of Clare castle keep

images.title: Oxyman / Clare Castle Motte, spiral footpath
images.caption: Clare Castle Motte, spiral footpath

description: This pretty country park is situated on the River Stour in the Suffolk town of Clare.  In the park you will find the remains of the 13th Century stone castle keep and the old Clare railway station.  There is a riverside walk where you can see a variety of wildlife and a railway walk with details of the park's history. The Bury to Clare Walk and Stour Valley Path walking routes also run through the park so there is scope for continuing your walk if you have time.  The park is located about 10 miles south of Bury St Edmunds, while the lovely Sudbury Water Meadows lie a few miles east.
